Rhombus $ ABCD$, with a side length $ 6$, is rolled to form a cylinder of volume $ 6$ by taping $ \overline{AB}$ to $ \overline{DC}.$ What is $ \sin(\angle ABC)$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \frac {\pi}{9} \qquad \textbf{(B)}\ \frac {1}{2} \qquad \textbf{(C)}\ \frac {\pi}{6} \qquad \textbf{(D)}\ \frac {\pi}{4} \qquad \textbf{(E)}\ \frac {\sqrt3}{2}$
